Text: Since it's Enterprise, I know I don't need an install key, but what about activation?  Will a Win7 loader work on this?

dwiss

Win7 loader won't work on Win8. It's a trial and you'll need to re-arm it when the trial is about to expire. You do that by:
1. Open command prompt
2. Type:

slmgr /rearm 

3. Hit enter.
Since this is the non-N version, have this the Windows Media Center and Windows Media Player?

Yes it has Media Player. Not sure about media center.
remember this will only give 5 re-arms and then it will start re-booting every 30mins approx.
People saying that you can re-arm 1000 times and such are incorrect.

Found this in the comments of http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7500071/WINDOWS_8_ENTERPRISE-N_RTM_X64_VOLUME_ENGLISH_BOOT_DVD_%5BThumperD

Open command promt as admin
If you are using Pro, type these lines ONE BY ONE!
slmgr -ipk NG4HW-VH26C-733KW-K6F98-J8CK4
slmgr /skms kms-c.no-ip.org:1688
slmgr.vbs -ato

If you are using Enterprise:
slmgr.vbs -ipk NG4HW-VH26C-733KW-K6F98-J8CK4
slmgr /skms kms-c.no-ip.org:1688
slmgr /ato
slmgr /dli

For me, activation details shows "Your license to use Windows expires on 2/2/2013"
Plenty of time for now, if this holds up.

info does not say how many days is the trial.. simply says not yet activated blah blah.. where to find how many days left for the trial to expire..? pls educate...

Just follow the instruction


Clean Your DNS Cache

1) Open CMD with Admin rights.

ipconfig /flushdns

2) Reboot system

3)Set TCP/IPv4 server addresses:

Preffered DNS server: 8 . 8 . 8 . 8
Alternate DNS server: 8 . 8 . 4 . 4

4). Restart the system. (restarting PC is important)

5). Run cmd as administrator.

6) Enter following commands one by one: 

slmgr -skms benderrodriguez-1-pt.tunnel.tserv28.waw1.ipv6.he.net

slmgr -ato 

Restart the system
anyone else knows where or how to know how many days left before the trial expires, BECAUSE IT DOES NOT STATES in the info, IT ONLY SAYS "NOT ACTIVATED,"
